s.text: Just remember: If it weren't for the Mac, there wouldn't be any Windows for Slate Explorer to run on.

I find it interesting that my representative in Congress, Thomas Bliley, can, with a straight face, recommend subsidies for these farmers when he and others in his party have vowed to get rid of "welfare as we know it."
Their particular narcissism renders them incapable of viewing any sort of interesting scandal around them.
It's a crime to quote that story about the fallen teen-ager, and then bring in two guys who would have no clue about Greek life!
For instance, members of Greek organizations have a higher average GPA than regular students.
For instance, members of Greek organizations have a higher average GPA than regular students.
It's a crime to quote that story about the fallen teen-ager, and then bring in two guys who would have no clue about Greek life!
It's a crime to quote that story about the fallen teen-ager, and then bring in two guys who would have no clue about Greek life!
And on the face of it, why not?

I find it interesting that my representative in Congress, Thomas Bliley, can, with a straight face, recommend subsidies for these farmers when he and others in his party have vowed to get rid of "welfare as we know it."
Slate received several letters in response to the Oct. 8 absence of "Today's Papers," whose author, Scott Shuger, had fallen ill:
